docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    about.md  # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: About This Project
docs.text: Welcome to My Site! This project is dedicated to documenting the various aspects of my work. Below is some useful information about the purpose of this project.

docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text:
This site is designed to provide clear and organized documentation for the project hosted on GitHub. It covers everything from installation instructions to advanced usage and examples.

The primary goals of this project are: - To facilitate better understanding of how the code works. - To offer tutorials and examples for getting started. - To provide ongoing updates and improvements.

docs.title: Motivation
docs.text: The project was created with the intention of making it easier for developers and collaborators to contribute and understand the codebase. My goal is to ensure that this repository remains useful and maintainable over time.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
• MkDocs: A static site generator that's simple and easy to use.
  • Material for MkDocs: A modern and responsive theme for MkDocs.
  • Markdown: Used for writing all the documentation.

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.text: If you would like to contribute to the project, feel free to submit pull requests or open issues on the GitHub repository.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text: If you have any questions, feel free to reach out via the GitHub repository or through email@example.com.
